results.title: Hiro: the Hiroshima generation
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Lauzun, Fuji-TV and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: While interviewing a Japanese student, the cameras show the diversity of Japan’s youth. Shows the clashes and the integration of foreign ideas as the young people struggle for an understanding of Japanese culture 25 years after the bomb.

results.title: Hinkler: the aviator
results.creator_credit: John Armstrong, Penny Spence, EBU and Nine Network
results.brief_description: Bert Hinkler became an Australian hero and is remembered as one of the world’s greatest avaitors. His record-breaking solo flight from England to Australia in 1928 was completed in 15 days reducing the original record by half. People wore Hinkler hats, Hinkler flowers, ate Hinkler puddings and had Hinkler dances as part of the excitement following this achievement. The program recreates scenes and uses archival footage to bring to life not only one of the greatest pioneers in aviation, but also a period of our history.

results.title: Hinduism and the song of God
results.creator_credit: Elda Hartley, Irving Hartley and Hartley Productions
results.brief_description: Introduces the philosophy and religion of Hinduism, emphasizing the concepts of self-realization as expressed in the Bhagavada Gita. Deals with purpose in life the four yogas, the law of karma and the four stages of life.

results.title: Hindu family
results.brief_description: Describes the marriage of the daughter of a Brahmin and the customs of old and new India as they are reflected in the daily life of a Hindu family in the village of Atgaum in the province of Gujarat.

results.title: Hinchinbrook diary
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: An unobtrusive look at the farming community of Hinchinbrook, Quebec and its timeless lifestyle. The camera moves quietly through the lives of people busy doing what they have always done.

results.title: Himalayan lakes
results.creator_credit: Gopal Datt, K Khandpur and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: The beauty of the large lakes in the foothills region of the Himalayan Mountains, mecca of climbers and tourists from India and overseas. Includes many attractions in the numerous valleys - shrines, fast moving mountain streams and rushing rivers, Indian villages and house boats in all seasons of the year.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gopal Datt, K Khandpur and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: Himalaya: life on the roof of the world
results.brief_description: Discusses the relative position, importance and size of the Himalayas, their geological history and the origin of the monsoon rains and how the rivers from the roof of the world have built the valleys and civilizations of Asia. Customs and ways of living have not changed much and all the canyons share in a common Indian culture. Also the pervading influence of Tibet are shown in three simple canyon civilizations: Buddhist Sikkim, Hindu Ganges Canyon and Islamic Kashmir.

results.title: Himachal
results.creator_credit: N.S. Thapa, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: A portrait of Himachal Pradesh State and its progress in recent years. Snowbound in winter the valleys awake in spring, when the sheep are shorn for their fine carpet wools, and the crops are planted. Isolation which has held back the development of Himachal Pradesh is being broken down by the building of the Hindustan Tibet highway. Life of the village people Mandi, where pilgrims flock to the ancient temple; traditions of religion, art and folkdance; orchards, timber and potatoes as increasing valuable products; snow sports in winter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: N.S. Thapa, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
